bug.short_desc: [launcher] Add the ability to pass in addtional vmargs on the commandline

long_desc.thetext: Currently if you specify vmargs on the commandline they override the arguments passed via the eclipse.ini. For situations in particular such as passing in a -Dosgi.splashscreen it would enable multiple products to use the same eclipse configuration yet brand them differently including the splash screen which currently can't be done as the first splash screen found the one eclipse uses.

The current behavior was simple to implement, but is turning out to be quite limiting. We should attempt to fix this. We would need a new option that indicated that any remaining arguments on the command line would be appended to the VM command line instead of replacing it. (Note: I'm not sure whether appended or prepended is the "right" answer, but the intent would be to have the values specified override any *matching* previous values.)
You would also only be able to specify one of "-vmargs" or "-additionalvmargs" (or whatever it's called).

Marking as duplicate of bug 149994. Please comment there, the proposal is a -ini option to inidicate an ini file to read instead of trying to merge arg lists or having a -additionvmargs
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 149994 ***

moberhuber@node3:/var/log> df -k . Filesystem 1K-blocks Used Available Use% Mounted on /dev/cciss/c0d0p6 10489464 10489464 0 100% /var

bug.short_desc: Editor Conflict: Save as new file browse dialog should have better default

long_desc.thetext:
Edit file x.txt through RSE. Change x.txt outside RSE. Edit and save x.txt in RSE --> Editor conflict dialog is shown.
Choose "Save editor contents as new file" and click the Browse button. 1.) The browse dialog shows directories only but no files. 2.) The default for the new filename is the same as the directory name in which the conflict file resides. A better default would be e.g. "x.txt.new"
-----------Enter bugs above this line----------- RSE 1.0 Testing round 3 installation : Eclipse M20060629-1905 platform-3.2, cdt-sdk-3.1.0 RSE install : download RSE-runtime-core, runtime-dstore, runtime-remotecdt java.runtime : Sun 1.4.2_12 os.name: : Windows XP Home 5.1, Service Pack 2 ------------------------------------------------ systemtype : Linux-dstore targetos : Red Hat Enterprise Linux WS release 4 (Nahant Update 3) targetvm : Sun 1.4.2_12-b03 --------------------------------------
Good idea. Not sure if the suggested default is correct but will add after R1.
CC'ing Dave M Dave M -- Can you comment on this? I like this idea. See any problems with it?
Yeah, actually, I think I like that idea (of "x.txt.new") better than the current behavior.
Actually, looking at bug 162992, the default should probably be "Copy of x.txt" -- provided that the target filesystem does support spaces in file names.

If we make this "Copy of" we'll have to consider the national language implications. I would prefer numbering the copies thus if we copy xxx.txt the new version would be xxx.txt.1. This could be nicely extended if one should want to do the copy again without renaming xxx.txt.1.

bug.short_desc: Editor Conflict: Save as new file doesnt refresh the Remote Systems View

long_desc.thetext:
Make 2 connections to the same host (in my case, it was ssh connections) using alias names for the host name or address: For example, Connection A is to 193.81.18.161 Connection B is to parser.takefive.co.at
Edit file A/dir/x.txt in RSE and save Edit file B/dir/x.txt in RSE and save Edit file A/dir/x.txt in RSE and save --> Editor conflict dialog is shown
Choose "Save editor contents as new file", give filename dir/x.txt.new The file is loaded into the editor with the new name
--> Problem #1: The remote systems view does NOT show the file with the new name, neither under connection A nor under connection B
Choose A/dir : Show in Table --> Contents is correct, but RSE tree not updated Choose B/dir : Show in Table --> Contents is correct, but RSE tree not updated
--> Problem #2: In the RSE tree, A/dir now shows an EMPTY directory node, even selecting the node and choosing Refresh does not help.
Workaround: Choose the PARENT directory of dir and select refresh, it fixes the display again (see also bug 143458). I consider this important to fix (P2) since view refresh display problems seriously undermine the user's confidence in RSE.
-----------Enter bugs above this line----------- RSE 1.0 Testing round 3 installation : Eclipse M20060629-1905 platform-3.2, cdt-sdk-3.1.0 RSE install : download RSE-runtime-core, runtime-dstore, runtime-remotecdt java.runtime : Sun 1.4.2_12 os.name: : Windows XP Home 5.1, Service Pack 2 ------------------------------------------------ systemtype : Linux-ssh targetos : Red Hat Enterprise Linux WS release 4 (Nahant Update 3) targetvm : Sun 1.4.2_12-b03 --------------------------------------

After doing the save as, the same IRemoteFile for one connection ends up being the stored in the tree for the other. I tried turning off deferred queries and that problem doesn't happen with that - so it probably has something to do with the SystemView.add() method.

bug.short_desc: Arrays of Generics

long_desc.thetext:
When I have a line of Java code like the following: List<Result>[] listArray = new List[256]; The following warning is issued: Type safety: The expression of type List[] needs unchecked conversion to conform to List<Result>[]
However, if I try to follow that suggestion and alter the code as follows: List<Result>[] listArray = new List<Result>[256]; The following error is issued: Cannot create a generic array of List<Result>
There is no way to make the IDE happy about this line of code.
The spec mandates issuing an unchecked warning in this case. However the quickfix is not adapted, since, as you observed, it generates invalid code.
Please reopen if there's more input.

FYI, I've opened bug 162716 to improve the general fragility of this code in the future.

bug.short_desc: Script in infinite loop, gerenates server logs

long_desc.thetext:
I'll need to disable the above script, as it never completes and generates the log below:
PHP Warning: feof(): supplied argument is not a valid stream resource in download.eclipse.org/webtools/downloads/drops/R2.0/I-I200608260752-200608260752/buildNotes.php
I've disabled it, as accessing this page would cause the browser to loop indefinitely. As our server logs filled, some e-mail and CVS problems occurred.

Apologies ... the main problem was I "improved" some of the content that is uploaded with each build ... but, forgot to go back and update the same files already uploaded in build already on drop site.

BTW, I'm not really sure why this problem would cause an indefinite loop ... so, if you have any insights into that, or, any recommendations on some "fail safe" behavior that should be in each script, let me know.

Reopening ... This infinite loop is happening with this script:
PHP Warning: fgets(): supplied argument is not a valid stream resource in download.eclipse.org/webtools/downloads/drops/R2.0/S-2.0M2-200610062204/testResults.php on line 14, referer: http://download.eclipse.org/webtools/downloads/drops/R2.0/S-2.0M2-200610062204/

How about now? I think I fixed this one late last night, but it was not replicating in cluster (or fixing permissions) due to server overload (I hope overload was not due to the log filling up! :<
But this morning the download-test version seems fine. Is the download-test version expected to be "in synch"?
So, even if fixed, I still do not understand why it would be an infinite loop. Is the infinite loop caused by some rougue script/crawler that "keeps trying" until it gets results back? If its the browser itself doing that, perhaps the PHP needs to be set up so that "fatel errors" _are_ returned to browser, instead of just logging, and not returning anything?
Using the download-test site, I saw where M1 version till had an error. So have fixed the php script, but it may not have replicated yet, or something?

(In reply to comment #5) > How about now? Seems to work now, thanks.
> But this morning the download-test version seems fine. Is the download-test > version expected to be "in synch"? download-test points to the same files as download. It simply has PHP warnings/errors displayed.
> So, even if fixed, I still do not understand why it would be an infinite loop. > Is the infinite loop caused by some rougue script/crawler that "keeps trying" > until it gets results back?
I don't think so, because from my browser I was able to experience it. I'd have to look at your old code to see what was causing this. Do you still have it available?
> If its the browser itself doing that, perhaps the > PHP needs to be set up so that "fatel errors" _are_ returned to browser, > instead of just logging, and not returning anything?
If the browser kept retrying, it's because it was (somehow) being told to do so. Displaying warnings and errors wouldn't have prevented it it.

> > I don't think so, because from my browser I was able to experience it. I'd > have to look at your old code to see what was causing this. Do you still have > it available? >
I can make it available. The main problem was that one of the very first things in the index.php file, right after <body> was a bad "include" directive:
<body>
<?php include '../../report.php'; $testResults = parse_testResult("testResults.php"); list ($compileErrors, $compileWarnings, $junitFailures) = $testResults; ?>
Perhaps its related to the fact that the link reference is to a directory, and the "index.php" is inferred by the webserver as one of the file names to try by default.
I have made a copy of a bad version and put it (temporarily) in http://download.eclipse.org/webtools/committers/drops/R2.0/I-I200610252259-200610252259/indexVERYBAD.php
Normally the link would be http://download.eclipse.org/webtools/committers/drops/R2.0/I-I200610252259-200610252259/ and "index.php" inferred.

I've removed the "very bad" test script from drop site.
And, since this is no longer a problem, I'll close this bug.
If we learn more about why exactly the "infinite loop" was occuring, we should document it and/or fix infrastructure. It might, for example, be related to the fact that the error occurred before any httpd response was generated, so, maybe? the cluster/fallback mechanisms would try another of the "default files"?

BTW, I did try this error on my local test machine, and it just displayed a blank page ... and logged the error once ... and following was the 'source' returned to the browser. So ... not sure what it is about Eclipse's infrastructure that causes the infinite loop ... just providing this FYI. Notice in the following source that was returned to browser, there is no end-body or end-html tags.
<html> <head> <meta http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1"> <link rel="stylesheet" href="http://dev.eclipse.org/default_style.css" type="text/css"> <title>Download</title> </head>
<body>

bug.short_desc: Drop site files are spaghetti code

long_desc.thetext:
Just wanted to write a reminder to fix up drop site web files. They are currently poorly structured thus making them fragile. This is mostly simply due to small "fixes" and changes that have made things worse and worse over the years.
Here's a few highlights that are fundamental problems.
There are some purely static files that are uploaded with each build, as though they were dynamic. This included PHP files which do not change from build to build, as well as simply GIF files, etc. These files should be moved "up" to a constant part of download site.
Visual presentation mixed with data. There are several files where the file is completely constant from build to build, except for some relatively small bits of "data". One example is the "test results" PHP file. The thing that changes is the "table rows" that contain the plugins and/or the JUnit suite names and the "count" of warnings or errors. Ideally the names and numbers would be pure data, and any change in display know how to read that data.
*** Remember that any fixes, improvements in these areas not only have to be made for the _new_ builds, but may also have to go back and fix the builds that are already on the build site and, ideally, even on the archives sites.

From exception stack view, this issue is caused by JavaProject.getOutputLocation() method. Seen from souce code, Btm instrumented application need located project output path when using AspectJ instrumentation mechanism. But profiling J2EE application, profile dialog using attach mode to profile J2EE application and it used default profile project and not user test project(it can't specify user project and main class name under attach mode). But profile project isn't java project so it can't get getOutputLocation() method.

I have found a way to specify profile project when profile J2EE application. When launching profile J2EE application, profile on server windows will be shown. Specify profile project location in destination tab of monitor page to user J2EE application project. And warning dialog shouldn't be appeared now. But it brings another question that Btm located project output location and place aop.xml file into class\META-INFO folder. Its expected location is in WebContent folder.
4.3 is closed. Targetting to 4.4.
Updating Priority
Not containable in 4.4

bug.short_desc: runtimeProvider and WsdlGen preferences should also be configurable per project

long_desc.thetext: Each project should has its own runtime provider and wsdl-gen settings to override the global preferences.

is to have a similar feture as the JDT preferences? that could be nice.
there are a couple of things to remember however: - the kit location: when the sc nature is added to a project, an env variable (unique to that project) is created to store the kit location and then, the build path of the project is setup from that var. so the kit used by a given project could be change by just changing the value of that var. - there is a story to extend the preference to allow users to register more than one kit per provider type, a bit like the way we can register more than one jvm in the JDT prefs.

(In reply to comment #1) > is to have a similar feture as the JDT preferences? that could be nice. > > there are a couple of things to remember however: > - the kit location: when the sc nature is added to a project, an env variable > (unique to that project) is created to store the kit location and then, the > build path of the project is setup from that var. so the kit used by a given > project could be change by just changing the value of that var. bug.short_desc: Error accessing problem marker from problem list

long_desc.thetext:
Problem: While a CPP Managed project is recompiling because you corrected a code problem, as the project recompiles you double click on the next problem in the Problem View, you get a ton of error messages. This happens both on Windows and linux, worse on linux, application seems to freeze-up for a few minutes while the project is recompiling.
Expected Result: No error messages in the log
Steps:
1.Open a CPP Managed project of a fare size, with multiple compile errors
2.Double click on the first problem in the list, correct it and Save. This will rebuild the project (Automatic Build).
3.As the project is rebuilding, double click on the next error in the list.
4.Error log view will start to fill up with messages ('Marker id: $number not found' and 'Error accessing marker type' messages).
We'll take a look and hopefully fix this for 3.1.2
Hmm...I cannot reproduce this (I have > 200 errors in my project). Janees, do you have a stack trace?

I tried this on a small project and was able to reproduce. There is how i did.
0. ensure auto build is on 1. make 2 errors in same class 2. save the file 3. clear the PDE 'Error Log' 4. go to problems view 5. click on the first error in problem view and correct it. 6. press ctrl+s and followed by double click on second problem in problems view. (build will be running as you click the second problem) 7. Check the PDE error log. You will see the said error.
Let me know if you are still not able to reproduce this, i will show it to you on my desktop.
I was able to reproduce it and I believe it might be related to bug 166979. I'll see if we can fix this.

This is actually a problem on the platform and it has been fixed in the 3.3M4 build. (See bug 149648) I've verified it and it works. Since CDT 3.1.2 only runs against Eclipse 3.2.x/Callisto, this will work in CDT 4.0.

bug.short_desc: [Progress] "Building workspace" job message starts with colon

long_desc.thetext:
I20061030-0010
"Building workspace" job message should not start with a colon. To reproduce, e.g. start a workspace rebuild and then try to import plug-ins.
Created an attachment (id=52920) Screenshot

Created an attachment (id=52943) Another screen shot
I don't see a : in any of our progress messages... I think it must be added in the progress view. However, I didn't see the same thing when I tried this.

Steps in I20061030-0800: - new workspace - Import > Plug-ins ... > Import As: Projects with source folder - choose org.eclipse.jdt.ui - import again, choose org.eclipse.core.expressions => dialog from comment 1
Moving to Plat/UI to check progress view messages.

Created an attachment (id=52945) Patch
Here is the fix. The message with the : comes from ProgressInfoItem.refresh(). It binds a message of the form <taskName>:<subTaskName>. If the task name is null it uses only the subtask name, but if the task name is the empty string, it will appear as :<subTaskName>. Someone must be calling IProgressMonitor.setTaskName("") during the operation. The fix is to use the same approach for an empty task name as for a null task name... just show the subtask name instead. I verified that this patch fixes the problem.
John please feel free to commit post M3.
I'll take this.
Fix released.

Sigh... my fix *did* work, but Tod released a change on Monday that overwrote my fix. Released again...
Fix released.

bug.short_desc: Standard and Managed Build Systems encorporation

long_desc.thetext: As part of the "New Project Model" activity (see bug#115935 and designs attached to that bug) we are planning to incorporate the current "Standard" and "Managed" build systems into one CDT Build System. bug.short_desc: Tool-Chain modifications functionality should be implemented

long_desc.thetext: As part of the "New Project Model" activity (see bug#115935 and designs attached to that bug) we are planning to implement the tool-chain modification functionality that will allow changing tool-chain settings for the project/configuration. This includes: Tool-chain substitution, adding/removing/substituting tools in the tool-chain, builder substitution.

Although the tool-chain modification functionality is implemented it needs some debugging. That is why it is currently disabled in UI.
It will be enabled soon. Targetting to 4.0M6..
Mikhail

Several enhancements and bug-fixes to the Tool-chain modification functionality were done recently. The tool-chain and builder substitution functionality is usable and stable now. We will need to make some updates to enable smarter filtering of tool-chains incompatible with the current one and probably some minor enhancements from the Gnu tool-chain integration to allow smarter tool add/remove mechanism.
The tool-chain modification UI is disabled by default for now. It could be enabled via preferences located at "C/C++"->"Property Pages settings".
I will not close the bug now since additional updates are needed. They will be done after the M6. Re-targetting to RC0
Mikhail

The proposed functionality is implemented. Setting the bug as FIXED.. All remaining problems that will be found could be logged/discussed as separate bugzilla entries.
Mikhail

bug.short_desc: Webstart fails because of too much underlines in jar-naming

long_desc.thetext:
If more than one underline is present in a pluginname the webstart bootloader cannot resolve the correct bundleid which causes a nullpointerexception on startup. Problem arised with 3.2.1 because the name of org.eclipse.osgi bundle changed to org.eclipse.osgi_3.2.1.r32x_v20060919.jar. (http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/equinox/drops/R-3.2.1-200609210945/index.php)
Class: WebStartMain Method: mapURLsToBundleList int versionIdPosition = bundleId.lastIndexOf('_'); bundleURLs = (ArrayList) bundleList.get(bundleId.substring(0, versionIdPosition));
=> The lastIndexOf method returns therefore not the correct position to extract the bundleid org.eclipse.osgi.
Possible solutions: + Proper naming scheme for bundles + indexOf('_') instead of lastIndexOf
greetings, Michael Mangeng

bug.short_desc: [formatting] Formatting scrolls viewport

long_desc.thetext:
I20061024-1200
1. Open a cu 2. Format cu 3. Save cu 4. Make editor window such small, that the editors vertical scrollbar becomes enabled 5. Set caret before last '}' 6. Type space 7. Format cu Is: The editor scrolls one line up Should: The editor does not scroll
This is especially annoying with clean up on save and enabled formatting.
Not sure if this is an editor bug or a bug in the formatting code.
Not sure whether you can fix this in JDT UI.

Yes you're right: org.eclipse.jface.text.AbstractDocument.stopRewriteSession(DocumentRewriteSession) is causing a call to org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.scrollVertical(int, boolean). Looks like the problem is connected to the fStableLine used in org.eclipse.jface.text.TextViewer.ViewerState.updateViewport() but I'm kinda lost in this code...

Does not work correctly in 3.2.1 either, but there the editor is scrolled down, behind the possible vertical scroll range...
On HEAD I see the following in updateViewport: Without the space it holds that: stableLine == fUpdaterDocument.getNumberOfLines() - 1 With the space added it holds that: stableLine == fUpdaterDocument.getNumberOfLines() - 2 resulting in a scroll In both cases the caret is on the same (last) line, so I guess stableLine should have the same value in both cases. Interesting is, that in the second case (with an additional space) the fStableLine.getOffset() is 2 _less_ then in the first case. The value is correctly set in org.eclipse.jface.text.TextViewer.ViewerState.connect(IDocument), something does then change the value before updateViewport is called.
Will investigate for M4 whether we can do something here.
This won't make it into M4.

Fixed in HEAD. Available in builds > N20070129-0010.
Fixed the problem that the viewport scrolls the caret out of the viewport. The general problem of scrolling the viewport cannot be completely solved since format can change a file dramatically.
There are still cases where it scrolls.
Created an attachment (id=58337) Source that shows the problem
Most likely not for 3.3.
The partial fix from comment 6 is causing us bug 186208. This is bad. I reverted that fix and will defer this to 3.4 (too risky at this point).
Using P5 to mark 3.4 candidate as planning didn't start yet.

bug.short_desc: [64] Screen corruption & disappearing scrollbars in the eclipse editor

long_desc.thetext:
Eclipse Build id: M20060921-0945 Platform: Windows XP x64 JDK: jdk1.5.0_09 (Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM)
Note: Problem is reproducable with the 32-Bit JVM & Eclipse Build as well as the 64-Bit JVM & Eclipse Build.
Steps to Reproduce: 1) Start Eclipse. 2) Open several source code files. 3) Work with the files for a while. The exact cause of the corruption is as yet undetermined, but it occurs after a fairly short time. 4) Screen corruption will occur as shown in the screenshot attached. It seems as if the scrollbars dissappear and the area that was previously occupied by those bars are now claimed by the editing area, but not consistently updated. This is made explicit by the small blue area in the middle of the right side of the editor. This is a "left-over" from the line highlighting. Similarly the bottom line (where the left/right scrollbar was previously) sometimes contains a line of source code, but one that is not related to the current offset in the file (which is somewhat confusing).
It might be that these problems have something to do with the color scheme I used (which is basically a variant of the GNU/Emacs color scheme). Nevertheless it is strange that the scrollbars themselves dissappear entirely. Even closing the file and re-opening it doesn't seem to fix this. The problem also appears to be buffer local (meaning that it can show up for one file and not for the other).
I realize that this bug is not concrete, since it does not contain a cause or sequence of events leading up to the problem. Nevertheless I found it interesting (and annoying) enough to report.

Created an attachment (id=52927) Scrollbar/Editor corruption in Eclipse
The image shows the screen corruption. Where there are normally scrollbars there is now some unsynchronized part of the editor.

Just to point out that this issue appears to exist in 3.3 M4, too
Unpredictable, but it definitely happens
(this is 32-bit Eclipse, full installation with no additional plugins running on Windows x64)

I'm seeing what seems to be similar effects, which mostly manifest themselves in the form of missing scrollbars, but also in odd, mid-pane scrolling. I'm also running Windows XP x64 and have experienced the bug in Eclipse 3.2.1 x64 and Eclipse 3.2.1 standard with jdk1.6.0 x64. The bug is not apparent on Suse Linux 10.2 x64 with jdk1.6.0 x64.

Can we push for a priority-raise on this please? It makes the use of Eclipse in x64 really hard. It might not seem like it, but this is a really unpleasant bug and seems to be unique to Eclipse on x64 - no other software appears to exhibit this 'feature'

I've think I've noticed a repeatable pattern for this.
1) Have Eclipse open with a file open for edit - make sure the file is large enough to require scrollbars. 2) Allow the workstation to go into screensaver, requiring a password to unlock 3) Unlock the desktop with your password
Lo, when the desktop re-opens, the scrollbars will have disappeared from the editor

This is very likely fixed now, see https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=142965#c29 , marking report as a duplicate.

bug.short_desc: Accessibility for Tree/TreeItem not customizable independent from OS

long_desc.thetext:
Although the proposed workaround for the bug (115947) is platform dependent I understand that there will be no API added in the 3.2.x maintance stream.
How do I stay up to date what API will be added to 3.3?
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 115947 ***

although that are interesting enhancements (so I CCed myself) but nothing about getting the tree item in a platform independent way.
Is the proposed API already implemented and released to the 3.3 stream? Or will there be an update in 115947? (As it is RESOLVED/FIXED I supposed there will not be any more update)
The proposed API was implemented and released into the 3.3 stream. See bug 115947 comment 17: https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=115947#c17

Any comments following comment 17 in bug 115947 were discussing possibly back-porting the new api to eclipse 3.2 update releases. However this was not done, and a workaround for people running 3.2 and earlier was given.

bug.short_desc: Error when deploying to JBoss

long_desc.thetext:
Our dev team just installed Eclipse 3.2 and JBoss 4.0 on our local Window XP machines.
It appears(?) that the issue is that Eclipse will rebuild and redeploy the EAR to JBoss while at the same time opening up IE and trying to load the JSP. JBoss eventually will see the new EAR and it has to go through a process of unloading the current EAR from memory and then reloading the new EAR. The error I see is happening when JBoss unloads the current EAR from memory as far as I can tell.
When trying to run a JSP page from within the Eclipse 3.2 IDE I am getting the following error:
HTTP Status 500 -
type Exception report message description The server encountered an internal error () that prevented it from fulfilling this request. exception java.lang.NullPointerException org.jboss.mx.loading.RepositoryClassLoader.findClass(RepositoryClassLoader.java:620) java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) org.jboss.mx.loading.RepositoryClassLoader.loadClassImpl(RepositoryClassLoader.java:464) org.jboss.mx.loading.RepositoryClassLoader.loadClass(RepositoryClassLoader.java:405) java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(Unknown Source) org.acegisecurity.ui.ntlm.NtlmProcessingFilter.onPreAuthentication(NtlmProcessingFilter.java:344) org.acegisecurity.ui.AbstractProcessingFilter.doFilter(AbstractProcessingFilter.java:200) org.acegisecurity.util.FilterChainProxy$VirtualFilterChain.doFilter(FilterChainProxy.java:274) org.acegisecurity.ui.ExceptionTranslationFilter.doFilter(ExceptionTranslationFilter.java:110) org.acegisecurity.util.FilterChainProxy$VirtualFilterChain.doFilter(FilterChainProxy.java:274) org.acegisecurity.context.HttpSessionContextIntegrationFilter.doFilter(HttpSessionContextIntegrationFilter.java:191)
org.acegisecurity.util.FilterChainProxy$VirtualFilterChain.doFilter(FilterChainProxy.java:274) org.acegisecurity.util.FilterChainProxy.doFilter(FilterChainProxy.java:148) org.acegisecurity.util.FilterToBeanProxy.doFilter(FilterToBeanProxy.java:90) org.jboss.web.tomcat.filters.ReplyHeaderFilter.doFilter(ReplyHeaderFilter.java:96) note The full stack trace of the root cause is available in the Apache Tomcat/5.5.20 logs.
This seems to be a Jboss bug and should be filed there.
Thanks for your help.

bug.short_desc: Numerous file not found errors

long_desc.thetext:
My Apache logs are filled with Callisto errors:
File does not exist: download.eclipse.org/callisto/releases/plugins/org.eclipse.emf.codegen_2.2.1.v200609210005.jar.pack.gz File does not exist: download.eclipse.org/callisto/releases/plugins/org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.sqm.core.ui_0.9.1.200608251.jar.pack.gz File does not exist: download.eclipse.org/callisto/releases/plugins/org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.sqm.core_0.9.1.200608251.jar.pack.gz File does not exist: download.eclipse.org/callisto/releases/plugins/org.eclipse.emf.codegen.ui_2.1.0.v200609210005.jar.pack.gz File does not exist: download.eclipse.org/callisto/releases/plugins/org.eclipse.emf.codegen.ecore_2.2.1.v200609210005.jar.pack.gz File does not exist: download.eclipse.org/callisto/releases/plugins/org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.sqm.server.ui_0.9.1.200608251.jar.pack.gz File does not exist: download.eclipse.org/callisto/releases/plugins/org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.ui.dse_0.9.1.200608251.jar.pack.gz File does not exist: download.eclipse.org/callisto/releases/plugins/org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.ui_0.9.1.200608251.jar.pack.gz File does not exist: download.eclipse.org/callisto/releases/plugins/org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity_0.9.1.20060831.jar.pack.gz File does not exist: download.eclipse.org/callisto/releases/plugins/org.eclipse.emf.exporter_2.2.0.v200609210005.jar.pack.gz File does not exist: download.eclipse.org/callisto/releases/plugins/org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.finfo_0.9.1.200609191.jar.pack.gz File does not exist: download.eclipse.org/callisto/releases/plugins/org.eclipse.datatools.lpg_1.0.0.200608021.jar.pack.gz File does not exist: download.eclipse.org/callisto/releases/plugins/org.eclipse.datatools.sqltools.common.ui_0.9.0.200605101.jar.pack.gz
I'm not sure why there errors are occurring, but they're taking up lots of log space on the servers.

I'm moving to UpdateManager for comment or solution. I believe there really are not intended to be "gz" files for these cases. They were never provided by projects, or, that is, conditioned jars not provided.
So, I think, the question is, is UpdateManager trying "gz" first, and counting on an "error" response coming back, before it tries the "jar" version? If so, would it be better to try a HEAD request first, instead of a GET? to see if the file exists? Or would that still cause similar warning to be logged?

(In reply to comment #1) > So, I think, the question is, is UpdateManager trying "gz" first, and counting > on an "error" response coming back, before it tries the "jar" version?
Ugh, this probably has something to do with the pack200. UM perhaps looks for a packed JAR and if none is found, then will look for a normal jar. Instead of polling the server, why would this not be defined in site.xml? I swear you developers have no consideration for the delicate feelings of a SysAdmin ;)
> If so, would it be better to try a HEAD request first, instead of a GET?
Makes no difference, they both return a 200 (OK) or a 404., which generates the same amount of log entries.
Adding platform-update to the CC as they'll never see this bug otherwise.

> I swear you developers have no consideration for the delicate feelings of a > SysAdmin
Don't forget pack200 support was added for the purpose of saving bandwidth ;)

(In reply to comment #3) > Don't forget pack200 support was added for the purpose of saving bandwidth ;)
Ah, then I partly take that back... Now if UM can save bandwidth without generating 2 GB of logs each week, then I'm a happy camper. Am I asking too much?

The recommended way to implement this seems to use the "encoding" field of an http header and do the appropriate processing in response to that (http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/guide/deployment/deployment-guide/pack200.html#theory).
However with the current architecture of update where the transport is used transparently, I'm not sure on how this could be applied.

Actually the site.xml does (should/can) say whether or not it has any packed content. Theoretically the site.xml could know for each entry whether or not there is packed content however, (you knew there was at least one...)
- the site.xml does not in fact list all features and certainly does not list any plugins (the main thing that is packed).
- Even if the site.xml could contain the needed information, we would need some level of tooling to manage the site.xml content as people add/remove things from the update site.
Callisto surely have packed content so that bit is likely turned on in the site.xml. The question then is, why doesn't everyone supply packed content? Perhaps there should be bug reports against EMF, DTP et al asking them to produce packed content?
It wasn't a "must do" for all teams to provide packed content for Callisto. So I think the only teams

It wasn't a "must do" for all teams to provide packed content for Callisto.
http://www.eclipse.org/projects/callisto.php
If my memory serves me, I think the only teams that provided packed content for Callisto were WTP and Eclipse.
However, pack 200 is a "must do" for Europa. http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Europa_Simultaneous_Release#Must_Do
so do we close this as WONTFIX?
Sure, go ahead. This isn't major in any way.
closing as per the comments, the problem becomes smaller as more groups pack their jars

bug.short_desc: framework extension causes launch cycles

long_desc.thetext:
I have installed the CDS framework extension into my Eclipse 3.2 installation and started the IDE with J9 and class sharing enabled. Within the IDE I tried to start a runtime workbench with a custom config.ini. The result was that the launch fails and starts again, fails and starts again, etc. without any error message. It just starts over and over again...
Interestingly the same happened after I re-started the IDE with the Sun VM without the framework extension.
After re-starting the IDE with -clean everything works fine (Sun VM without extension, J9 with class sharing, everything...).
I sadly failed to create a reproduceable setting for this (tried many different things). Sorry...

Martin, have you seen this happen any more? Can you attach the custom config.ini you were using to launch from PDE. There are scenarios that force the framework to restart very early on. This usually involves a config.ini change that removed one of your osgi.framework.extension bundles. When this is done we launch with the framework extension bundle installed, but then detect that it should be uninstalled and refreshed. The refresh operation causes the restart. But on restart we should not do the operation over again to cause another restart. I am unable to get an endless restart to occur. Maybe there was something special in your custom config.ini?

Unfortunately I am not able to reproduce this anymore. As I remember the custom.ini was not very special with regards to framework extensions. The config.ini was quite simple just adding some extra bundles to the default bundle list to let the framework start them with a specified start level, thats all. No extensions defined at all...
Should we close this as works-for-me?
I guess so. We can reopen if we encounter it again. Sorry my investigation did not turn up anything to help reproduce this.
Thank you very much for taking a look at this!!!

bug.short_desc: C Indexer findIncludes() method throws away first include file.

long_desc.thetext:

I have selected the fast indexer, and defined PDOMDependencyGenerator as dependency calculator in my build definitions. This all seems to function properly as I can see the dependency generator is being called.
In this process however, the indexer method CIndex.findIncludes() is called to get all include files for a given resource, and this method contains the following sequence:
findIncludes(Collections.singletonList(file), result, depth, new HashSet()); result= result.subList(1, result.size());
The first line seems to correctly return a list of all include files, but the 2nd line decides to always remove the 1st entry.

bug.short_desc: Probekit still collects data when agent is paused

long_desc.thetext: Probekit still collects data when the profiling agent is paused from the workbench. This problem lies either in the JVMPI agent extension or in the workbench plugin.
Created an attachment (id=55813) Patch

Caution should be used when using pause/resume feature. Once a class is instrumented with dynamic probekit, it can never be de-instrumented. Also when the opportunity to instrument a class is given up then that class can never be instrumented. The JVMPI_EVENT_CLASS_LOAD_HOOK is only called once per class. This is why pause/resume of instrumentation should always be done on the client side (i.e. handled by the Probe itself).

Created an attachment (id=56103) Patch
This patch fixes this problem by modifying the piAgent. The old patch didn't work when the agent was started in pause state. The modified file is JvmpiWriter.c.
Hi Samson, since you're the new owner of piAgent, could you please review and approve the attached patch? it modifies a file in the piAgent.
Setting priority to P1 and updating the sizing.
Fix submitted with Samson's approval.

bug.short_desc: ArrayUtil has no clear specification

long_desc.thetext:
Looking at the implementation you can see that the class makes changing assumptions on how the arrays it operates on look like. This is very confusing and it is likely that this introduces bugs to client code.
Examples: append(...) expects nulls everywhere, may perform insert instead of append. prepend(...) behaves like append(!) except if the array is full. trim(...) assumes that nulls occur at the end only.
I suggest to create two separate utilities, one optimized for arrays with nulls at the end, only and the other always checking for nulls anywhere. The existing class should be deprecated.

I don't think this class was meant to be semantically significant. It was written by a bunch of C developers trying to do Java :).
Do with it as you please.

Here a summary of my changes: * changed append(..) and prepend(..) to behave properly. This also solves a preformance problem in the LocationMap. * added an even more performant append(..) method. * removed method replace(..) as it was not used. * went through all the usages and replaced removeNulls() with trim() and append(...) with the new append(...) where it was appropriate. * added test cases.
Fixed in 4.0 > 20061031.

My version of Java is jdk1.5.0_06 My version of ant is 1.6.5 (downloaded from apache) I'm running this on a Sun Sparc node running Solaris 10.
In the "eclipse" subdirectory, I invoke the build as: build -os solaris -ws gtk -arch sparc -java5home /usr/jdk/latest or build -os solaris -ws motif -arch sparc -java5home /usr/jdk/latest
The error occurs about an hour into the build, and looks something like: [javac] 1. ERROR in /users/lcdubbe/builds/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.pde.build/src/org/eclipse/pde/internal/build/FeatureWriter.java [javac] (at line 24) [javac] public class FeatureWriter extends XMLWriter implements IPDEBuildConstants { [javac] ^^^^^^^^^^^^^ [javac] The return type is incompatible with Writer.append(CharSequence, int, int), PrintWriter.append(CharSequence, int, int) [javac] ---------- [javac] 2. ERROR in /users/lcdubbe/builds/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.pde.build/src/org/eclipse/pde/internal/build/FeatureWriter.java [javac] (at line 24) [javac] public class FeatureWriter extends XMLWriter implements IPDEBuildConstants { [javac] ^^^^^^^^^^^^^ [javac] The return type is incompatible with Writer.append(char), PrintWriter.append(char) [javac] ---------- [javac] 3. ERROR in /users/lcdubbe/builds/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.pde.build/src/org/eclipse/pde/internal/build/FeatureWriter.java [javac] (at line 24) [javac] public class FeatureWriter extends XMLWriter implements IPDEBuildConstants { [javac] ^^^^^^^^^^^^^ [javac] The return type is incompatible with Writer.append(CharSequence), PrintWriter.append(CharSequence) [javac] ----------
thanks for any help or suggestions - linda

This is because PDE Build needs to be compiled against a JRE 1.4. In your build you need to set a propery J2SE-1.4 that refers to a file set containing all the jar from a 1.4 JRE. I still find that weird. CC'ing Kim for clarifications.

Yes, you need to have both a 1.4 and 1.5 vm to run the source build.
See the instructions here
http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/drops/R-3.2.1-200609210945/srcIncludedBuildInstructions.html
Install Ant and a JDK as per each program's instructions. Minimally you will need the following environment variables set.
1. Add the Ant bin directory to your path. 2. Set the JAVA_HOME environment variable to the root of your 1.4 JDK installation. 3. Set the ANT_HOME environment variable to the root of your Ant installation. 4. (Windows 98) Increase the default environment space as specified here.
Run the Build
1. Extract the eclipse-sourceBuild-srcIncluded-*.zip to an empty directory. Extract using tar if using a *nix drop. 2. cd to the directory. 3. Execute build -os <osType> -ws <windowSystemType> -arch <architecture> -java5home <java 5 installation> [-bc <bootclasspath>] [-compilelibs] [-target <target>]
Closing as worksforme, but plz reopen if you still have problems.

bug.short_desc: IndexBasedCodeReaderFactory cache contains deleted file references on reindex

long_desc.thetext:
hi,
I've seen if you create a project, and manually reindex it, then every other reindex, the files associated with names are actually unmanaged areas of the pdom. For example, using the index view to perform an open definition action opens a source file whose name is all unprintable characters.
It looks like the problem is that the IndexBasedCodeReaderFactory is being populated before the index has been cleared, and so the cache is populated with file entries which are then deleted at the clear stage.
thanks, Andrew

Created an attachment (id=52934) fix and regression test
please find attached a proposed fix which just move the clear stage to before the cache is populated

Thanks Andrew! The patch does not contain the test case.
Fixed in 4.0 > 20061030.

Created an attachment (id=52936) the regression test
oops - here is the regression test
thanks, Andrew
Thanks, I have added your test case.

bug.short_desc: [Import/Export] Error message is not displayed when special characters are enetered as export file name

long_desc.thetext:
Steps to reproduce: * Launch eclipse IDE. * Go to the File->Export Export Dialog pops up. * Expand General and click on Preferences * Click Next * Click on the Browse Button to select valid path for your file and click on "save" button * Now add special characters to the file name or path(<,>,@,#,$,%......),it should give the following error message like "Special characters are not allowed" etc.
Allowing these characters cause accessibility compliance failure.
How is this causing an accessibility issue?I don't see how this is any different for users with accessibility issues.

bug.short_desc: Project Hygiene -- correct bad/missing/incorrect copyright statements, and incorrect plugin versions

long_desc.thetext: Per Harm's e-mail, I have gathered the list of all copyright and plugin version problems. Submitting them underthis one buguzilla for approval. The plugin version problems will prevent the Update Manager from working properly with 4.3. The copyright problems are basic hygiene, and should be automated at some point.
